subject: Business
title: The Halo Effect in Branding
description: A fast breakdown of The Halo Effect in Branding for builders.

hook.text: People rate identical wine as tasting better when poured from an expensive-looking bottle. The bottle is the product.

buildup.text: The halo effect means one positive trait colors our perception of everything else about a brand.

discovery.text: Apple's design reputation makes people rate its customer service higher â€” even when it's average.

twist.text: The halo works in reverse too. One scandal can make customers doubt everything about a previously trusted brand.

climax.text: Volkswagen's emissions scandal didn't just hurt one car model. It tainted the entire brand's reputation for honesty.

punchline.text: One great trait lifts everything. One failure drags everything down.

quiz.question: What is the halo effect in branding?
options: One positive trait improves perception of all other brand qualities
A brand that glows in the dark to attract attention
The first brand in a category always wins
